Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: tbh, on demand blocks would be useful for sensor data being written to oracle. at the moment I get a few errors if blocks move slower than data refresh rate. I can work around it by storing in buffer until last oraclesdatatx block is confirmed, which would mostly work unless chains get real slow for too long.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: it adds a delay to data publication, which is fine for data  which is not time sensitive

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: but if dog goes missing and I have to wait 1hr  to get latest GPS coords, the lag makes the data much less useful.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: I'm sending every 5 min or so when not in safe zone, so it's a rare issue, but that solves it nicely

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: I can foresee other sensor data streams being closer to continuous though. But not on 3G. Will have to use wifi for that or it's stupidly expensive

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: GPS needs 3G cos the sensor is oscar mike. Something like soil moisture or aquarium pH would work on wifi, though both are bad examples of data streams needing near continuous readings....  but there are process plant sensors which need to react quickly and adjust things for optimal conditions (heat, flow rate etc) for whatever chemical process being done

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: yeah any monitoring @smk762 -  dracocanis ominator in the case of perishable goods delivery, temperature drops below a threshold can be used to calculate % discount as per contract condition, e.g. < 1hr (60 blocks) continuously below 5 degrees = 5% credit on next order, >1hr <4h = 8%, >4hr <24hr 12% etc.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: oracles uses mempool, so that shouldn;t be much issue ... just fund 1000 utxos üòÇ

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: the hardware is a particle.io kit, which comes with a sim and a portal to get events.  The portal can be accessed by browser, and offers a url to curl events from

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: I have a listener on the curl stream, which encrypts gps data with aes and then writes to the oracle.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: a sepearate script queries oracle on demand, triggered by browser reload. It decrypts oracle data back into gps string, and generates the HTML from a template with a few variables in it so track is shown and map zooms over it.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: browser map needs user/pass to access

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: nice

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: later down the track I'll see if I can code out the particle.io part of it and speak directly to the server

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content:
end goal is to have something that uses purely opensource assets with no potential for 3rd party tracking via cookies etc.
host everything on my own hardware.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
